result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek John Bregovits was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To 22CF33 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Payment of DNA surcharge only - from available prison monies.
Repayment of $185 buy money - from available prison monies.
All other fines and costs are remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No contact with known drug users or dealers except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.

Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-26-22.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To 22CF33 and any other sentence

6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence.
Credit for 180 days time served.
Remit fines and costs.
Payment of DNA surcharge only = $200 due within 90 days of being released from initial confinement in 22CF57 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

2 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, consecutive to 22CF33 and any other sentence.

Conditions of extended supervision:
